decks.notes: The main idea of this deck is to quickly cycle through cards and play aggressively to deal damage to the opponent. By using cards with cycling abilities like Boon of the Wish-Giver and Startling Development, the deck can draw through the deck quickly to find key cards like Zenith Flare. Zenith Flare deals damage based on the number of cards in the graveyard, making cycling even more effective. The deck also includes creatures like Valiant Rescuer and Drannith Stinger to provide additional damage and pressure. Overall, the deck focuses on aggressive cycling strategies to overwhelm opponents.

The deck focuses on controlling the board and out-valuing opponents through strong control elements like Teferi, Time Raveler and Shatter the Sky. It also utilizes Fires of Invention to cast powerful spells for free, such as Elspeth Conquers Death and Shark Typhoon. The inclusion of Yorion, Sky Nomad as a companion allows for a flexible and resilient game plan. The deck aims to overwhelm opponents with card advantage, board control, and powerful threats, ultimately grinding them out for the win.

The deck focuses on utilizing Fires of Invention to cast powerful spells for free, while controlling the board with cards like Shatter the Sky and Shark Typhoon. The deck also includes a companion, Yorion, Sky Nomad, to provide additional value through blinking permanents for extra card advantage. The strategy revolves around generating card advantage and disrupting the opponent's board state with cards like Teferi, Time Raveler, Narset, Parter of Veils, and Lukka, Coppercoat Outcast, while eventually overwhelming the opponent with threats like Elspeth Conquers Death and Agent of Treachery.

The deck aims to control the game by utilizing Fires of Invention to cast powerful spells for free. It includes various card draw and scrying effects to ensure consistency, as well as a strong Planeswalker package with Teferi and Narset. Agent of Treachery and Yorion, Sky Nomad provide additional value and disruption to the opponent's game plan. The deck also has a solid removal package with Shatter the Sky and Elspeth Conquers Death. Overall, the deck seeks to establish board control and outvalue the opponent in the late game.

This deck focuses on utilizing control elements to disrupt the opponent's strategy while ramping up with cards like Uro and Growth Spiral. Yorion, Sky Nomad acts as a powerful companion, providing extra value with its blinking ability. The deck aims to control the board with cards like Teferi, Time Raveler and Shatter the Sky while generating card advantage with Narset, Parter of Veils. Elspeth Conquers Death and Agent of Treachery provide powerful late-game options to close out the game. The deck is designed to outvalue opponents and grind out wins through incremental advantage.

The focus of this deck is to control the game through the use of powerful planeswalker cards and controlling spells. By utilizing cards like Narset, Teferi, and Lukka, the deck aims to maintain board control while also generating card advantage. The deck also includes removal spells like Shatter the Sky and Deafening Clarion to deal with threats from the opponent. The companion Yorion, Sky Nomad provides additional value by flickering permanents for extra value. Overall, the deck aims to outvalue and outcontrol the opponent to secure victory.

This deck focuses on utilizing Winota, Joiner of Forces to trigger powerful ETB effects from Humans and non-Humans. By consistently getting Winota onto the battlefield with cards like Raise the Alarm and Legion Warboss, the deck can quickly overwhelm opponents with threatening creatures like Brazen Borrower and Bonecrusher Giant. Teferi, Time Raveler provides disruption and protection while cards like Deputy of Detention and Agent of Treachery offer additional control options. The mana base is built to support a combination of white, red, and blue spells, ensuring consistent access to all colors.

The focus of this deck is to aggressively cycle through your cards while utilizing cards like Zenith Flare and Valiant Rescuer to deal damage to your opponent. By continuously cycling cards like Boon of the Wish-Giver and Startling Development, you can build up your board presence and overwhelm your opponent with a flurry of attacks. Lurrus of the Dream-Den serves as a valuable companion, allowing you to recur important cards from your graveyard. This deck aims to quickly close out the game by exploiting the cycling mechanic and utilizing powerful synergy between its cards.

The main idea of this deck is to control the game using cards like Teferi, Time Raveler and Fires of Invention while generating card advantage with Narset, Parter of Veils and Yorion, Sky Nomad. The deck focuses on board wipes like Shatter the Sky and stealing opponent's creatures with Agent of Treachery. It also includes cards for token generation and card selection to maintain control of the game. The goal is to out value the opponent and control the board until you can secure a win condition.

This deck focuses on using Fires of Invention to cast spells for free, allowing the player to control the game by playing powerful cards like Cavalier of Flame and Sphinx of Foresight. The deck also includes cards like Deafening Clarion and Teferi, Time Raveler to control the board and disrupt the opponent's strategy. The inclusion of Keruga, the Macrosage as a companion provides additional card draw and a powerful late-game threat. Overall, the deck aims to establish board control and overwhelm the opponent with strong creatures and disruptive spells.

This deck focuses on controlling the board and the opponent's resources using Fires of Invention to cast powerful spells for free. It seeks to slow down the opponent's game plan with cards like Deafening Clarion and Bonecrusher Giant, while also generating card advantage with Teferi, Time Raveler and Narset of the Ancient Way. The deck aims to stabilize during the mid-game with cards like Cavalier of Flame and Elspeth Conquers Death, eventually overwhelming the opponent with powerful threats like Sphinx of Foresight and Kenrith, the Returned King.

The deck focuses on controlling the board through spells like Teferi, Time Raveler and Fires of Invention, while also utilizing powerful creatures like Sphinx of Foresight and Cavalier of Flame to maintain pressure on the opponent. The inclusion of Keruga, the Macrosage as a companion provides card advantage and a way to refuel resources. The deck also features versatile cards like Narset of the Ancient Way and Kenrith, the Returned King to provide additional options for winning the game. Overall, the deck aims to control the game tempo and outvalue the opponent.

This deck focuses on controlling the game through a mix of counterspells, removal, and card advantage. By using powerful cards like Uro, Titan of Nature's Wrath, Nissa, Who Shakes the World, and Casualties of War, the goal is to outvalue and outlast the opponent. The deck also utilizes Yorion, Sky Nomad as a companion to provide additional value and flexibility. The mana base is designed to support the deck's three-color requirements and ensure consistent access to all necessary colors of mana.
